caption: Our whole family agrees that this is some of THE BEST pizza we have ever had.The deep dish and the thin crust both are stellar.The thin crust was both a liitle crispy and a little chewy.HEAVENLY.The deep dish crust was an A+.It melted in your mouth.We ordered the thin crust and recieved thick.Glad we got to have them both.They were very nice and brought us another thin pizza also.Very accomodative.This is an extremely buisy sot so expect to wait.Not a bad idea to order in advance.Can't wait for our next round!
Best tiramisu in Chicago

Riccardo never disappoints. Enoteca is my favorite location, but my experience at all three locations have been consistently exceptional. The food is truly outstanding, and the service impeccable. Everyone—from the servers, support staff, and management—is personable, friendly, and happy to see you. I highly recommend our server, JP. He is conversational, funny, and delivers excellent service. I have a hard time not ordering my favorite dish: Rigatoni alla Buttera. This time, we also tried the burrata over arugula with pesto and the tortelloni. Both wonderful. My favorite restaurant in the city.

Yes! Love--cornbread like crust, smart toppings layering, fresh tasting sauce, not too greasy or overly flavored. Good textures and delicious! I didnt enjoy the cheese only/old school one as much as the other flavor though! ( too much cheese)
Great food and wine. Cozy place.
Great Italian food.
Nice collection of wine
delicious Italian food!
(Translated by Google) Nearby was the massacre on Valentine's Day in 1925  (Original) Рядом была бойня в день святого валентина в 1925 году
Amazing service and delicious food!

SOOO GREAT!! Very satisfied from the food, to the ambience, to the professional service. My gf and I took our moms up here for a nice dinner. Everyone ordered different dishes and they were all delicious. We started with grilled calamari which was some of the best grilled calamari I've ever had. Recommended by an old employee. Did not disappoint. Even the desert was exceptional! We had sorbetti, apple pie, and fruit with chantilly. You must go.
Great service. Beautiful atmosphere.
The food was amazing! The pasta was melt in your mouth fresh! Nice ambience too,
Server was really rude

Relaxed, cozy and great food. I had the seared duck which isn't offered but 1-2 times a year and this was the first time they had it on the menu this year! The prices are perfect for all their dishes. Servers are attentive and professional. Love it I see why they have regulars. You may want to make reservations we were bless they had room at the bar to sit and eat.
The customer service is regularly fast, awesome ambience, super friendly staff members. Will return again when I arrive in town.

Great atmosphere! Staff is incredibly efficient and friendly. The FOOD was incredible. If you like Italian cuisine, this is the real deal! We'll be making this a regular stop on our trips to the Windy City.

The wait across the street was too long so we went here instead and we’re sooooo glad we did. From the food to the service, everything exceeded expectations and we were definitely glad the wait was too long at our first destination.
Always a great experience here. Wonderful staff, homemade pasta, rich sauce and a romantic neighborhood feel. Highly recommended.
Highly recommend the cornish hen. Partner go the truffle pasta which was good but a little too truffley
We just happened upon this place tonight. Very quaint and cozy. The staff were all very attentive and friendly, literally a well-oiled machine! Yummy margarita pizza!

Absolutely amazing Authentic Italian cuisine! The Rigatoni was the best I’ve ever had, excellent! Our kids, 12, 8 and 2, as well as us adults all loved the Margherita pizza too. Our server, Jose, was very accommodating, professional, polite and helpful. Definitely recommend to eat here!
Charming little unpretentious neighborhood joint with fresh made pasta and friendly wait staff. Cute enough for date night and solid delivery on the food. Tuna tartare was great.
Fantástic lasagne and veal Parm. Great tiramisu. Beat waiting 3 hours for the pizza spot across the street

No stars for this place. This place runs like  taximeter.  After two hours even though you still consuming they kick you out. The manager( Cesar/ Ceaser)  is very rude even after you ordered about 5 drinks plus dinner. I will make sure that all my friends will never be there.

Rude, arrogant, manager (Cesar). We have been neighbors and customers for the last 6 years and were flabbergasted when the manager refused to accommodate an extra chair for our adult son to join us for dinner, after we (a couple) had already consumed around $100 with 6 drinks, an appetizer and an entree. According to the manager, we had already "occupied the table for too long", so we had to leave... Is this a restaurant or a parking lot?

Would give 0 stars if possible. My parents came here at around 6pm on a Friday to have dinner, knowing that I would later join them after I got off of work at around 7:30pm. When I arrived, the manager Ceasar refused to pull up a chair for me to join them, saying that my parents had been there too long already and that there were other people waiting to have dinner. My parents tried to explain that they have been consuming the food and drinks the entire time and that I was also going to consume, but the manager wouldn't have it. This was absurd! Never have I heard of a restaurant borderline kicking out guests over a 2 hour dinner service! Ceasar made it clear that this establishment prioritizes quantity of customers rather than quality of service - no really, he said it himself. To top it all off, we were going to return the next night for dinner with friends (a bigger party and more money) but clearly this has been cancelled. As a neighbor and Lincoln Park resident, my family, friends, and I will never return here and I will make sure to tell everyone I know what terrible service this restaurant has.
Absolutely stellar dinner tonight at Riccardo’s.  The pizza was incredibly flavourful.  Can’t go wrong with any of the pastas either.

The food is delicious, a neighborhood gem. The fava beans is a good choice for a starter, fettuccine bolognese is very tasty. The trout is another great option. The tiramisu is very authentic. Ask for Juan, he is an excellent server and made great recommendations
Great food with fantastic service. Smaller place but very nice layout in the space.

(Translated by Google) Yes nice, but Italian food is modified for American tastes. I give three stars for the lack of Wifi.  (Original) Sì bello, ma la cucina italiana è modificato per il gusto americano. Do tre Stelle per la mancanza del Wifi.
Returned to Enoteca and the food was even better than our previous visit.  Coupled with the cozy and inviting atmosphere and you have a great place for dinner.
Delicious!
Allways good...
Great service and delicious food. We did not have a reservation and yet we were seated right away. Thank you for a wonderful experience.
Always delicious with exceptional service.

Small place tge wait can be long if you hit it wrong. Good selection of salad, meat, fish and pasta. I had the grilled squid (or was it octopus?) Cooked perfectly slightly crunchy on edges. Best I have had in years if not ever. For sure a great option for dinner on a special night or any time you are in tye mood for good food.
Stumbled across this Hidden Gem. What a great meal. Ambience. Excellent service.

me and my husband went here tonight for our anniversary. We ordered a bottle of wine and went to place our appetizer orders and our server told us oh we cant put your appetizer order im until we have your entree order but take your time. ummm...im not sure after both appetizers and the wine we will be hungry. umm ok ill see what I can do. The manager doesnt really like that. Then, the one appetizer came out burnt. You could tell the server was frustrated ( over nothing ) but we  still gave a very generous tip
Their butera rigatoni is amazing !!

I am so stuffed after eating here, I didn't even manage to take any photos. Great restaurant to walk in and have fantastic Italian food. Every dish we ordered for a group of 5, from the burrata and carpaccio antipasti to the pastas and pizzas, hit the spot. If you're looking for a great Italian restaurant in Chicago, you won't go wrong.
Incredible food and service
Very good !
Just popped in for drinks, didn't eat, but wait staff was very friendly and food smelled great. Strong wine list!

This was a fantast little Italian restaurant in Lincoln Park. It was cozy with a good wine selection and great homey food. I had the gnocchi and it was delicious. They have gluten free options as well which was nice for an authentic place. The ambiance is perfect for a romantic but cozy date night.
Small Italian restaurant,  some outdoor seating
Decent

Had pizza in mind, after an eventful day of skydiving with a group of six and some tag alongs. After the long ride from Ottawa we find the line and wait time across the street unbearable. One quick look across the street and we found this sweet spot. Service; they arranged tables for us outside, provided some good appetizers, attentive staff inside and outside. We decided to order a round of four of their small pizzas, veggie to meaty. Perfect; sliced into individual portions and all delicious. We all walked away happy and contented with the experience.
Outdoor seating on a perfect summer evening set the stage for a fabulous Italian meal.
I like the food alot ....but when your server don't like you to be there make the restaurant a bad experience....sorry Riccardo...

I was originally going to eat across the street but the line was out the door. I am so glad I decided to eat here instead. I had the lobster ravioli, it was one of the best dishes I’ve had in my life. This place has become one of my all time favorite places to eat.

Chicago Grinder and Pizza Oven was the plan.  We even had our names on the list, and stepped into Riccardo for drinks and Antipasti while we waited the 2 hour wait across the street.  Our appetizer was the best calamari of my entire life.  It was grilled with some char, and melt-in-your-mouth with lots of flavor.  We decided to stay for our entire meal, and I'm glad we did.  The pork chop was amazing. The chocolate molten lava cake was not too sweet, absolutely perfect.  You couldn't beat their customer service or atmosphere.  This should be a major culinary destination.
Great food, great service.
Great service and food
Everyone is so friendly. Food is to die for. Do yourself a favor
Very good food and pleasant service. Enjoyed my time there.
Try the Tiaramisu... it was delicious.  I also recommend the risotto.  The sea bass was very good as well.
Great food and very friendly staff!
Delicious! Everything is fresh and made from scratch and our waiter was very attentive. Overall great experience!
Rock solid traditional Italian fare with impeccable service.  Rustic, old world charm....like a scene out of The Godfather.
Wonderful food, wonderful staff. Accommodated a large party and kept us well fed. No one went away unhappy.  Highly recommend the grilled eggplant and zucchini parmesan appetizer.
Great authentic Italian

Riccardo Michi  comes from a restaurant Family in Milan established since 1943 called Girarrosto, one of the first Tuscan restaurants in town and still operating. After moving to the US, Riccardo opened Sonny Bono, IL Giardino Ristorante and Madeo Ristorante in Beverly Hills. In 1987  he helped his cousin Roberto Ruggeri open the first Bice restaurant in New York City. Since then, he has worked in the opening of many of the restaurants in the group. In 2002 Riccardo moved to Chicago with his wife Veronica to be the executive chef of Bice on Ontario
Great place with good food and wine.
A good italiuan spot. Its small and intimate. Right accross the street is their slightly more formal
Great spot
Great staff, great gluten free pizza

My husband and I have been on a search for the "perfect" neighborhood Italian restaurant since moving to Chicago from New York five years ago. Riccardo Enoteca did not disappoint. The restaurant is cozy, authentic, with a friendly, welcoming wait staff. We will for sure be back again soon.
The ambient is quiet and nice, good service and staff. The food is amazing! Italian food as is should be.

Service was wonderful and the food is delicious! We are excited to make ourselves regulars here. Our favorites were the sausage pizza which was crisp and airy, the chicken Parmesan was delicious and quite the generous serving, and the salads are all crave worthy. Excited to eat our leftovers tomorrow.

Our flight got canceled. We ended up staying an extra night in Chicago. Our family in Chicago recommended Riccardo Enoteca and it was phenomenal. The trout was unbelievably phenomenal. We are from Florida and love a fresh fish. Thank you to Caesar and Juan for the great service too
Delicious branzino and asparagus, authentic Italian menu
Best Italian restaurant in town. Cozy and great food! Staff is amazing.
Best Italian cuisine in Chicago! Excellent food for a fair price.
Good was excellent,  ask for a table by the window...its more quite
Decent service. Bad food.
Came here instead of waiting 2+ hours for CPOG. It was good - I'd go back. Good food and good, quick service.

The food, wine, and oh my, the cheesecake, all were really good, great place to celebrate my sister's bday, just, our waiter could have been a little more warm, but the service in itself was great, great place to come and spend a great chat over great food, will come back!
Great drinks (they have beer!) and food. Got tiramisu for dessert and it was fantastic!
Lovely atmosphere. Great service. Meals are served slowly (in a good way so you don't have to rush). Do skip the calamari and octopus. They were rubbery. The rest of our dishes were excellent.
Friendly service, nice place, we just went for drinks though, small beer selection, didn't get to try the food.
Hidden gem with amazing pastas and neapolitan style pizza. Get the hot bruschetta - even if you don't see it on the menu!

We randomly happened upon the restaurant after getting pet meds at Braun's, and I could not have been more pleasantly surprised and impressed.   The food was delicious, everything from the bread and salad to the salmon dish - that I cautiously ordered as I normally eat meat-free.  I was nervous, but the dish (and everything else) was delicious, and perfectly cooked.  The wine was outstanding too.   All of these things are fairly easy to find in a Chicago restaurant.  What sets Riccardo Enoteca apart was the service.  Everyone from the host to the waiters, even those serving other tables, were remarkable.  Very welcoming, very on-point, not too intrusive, and utter gentlemen.  I will no longer dread making the trek to Braun's for my cat's meds because I now have Riccardo Enoteca to look forward to as a treat for myself.
Rude host
The Lasagna was excellent, service was good though a bit pretentious, but that might just be my Californian coming out. Decent wine list though no beer to speak of :-( had a tasty desert menu too!
